action.action-desc: Mr. DeSantis (for himself and Mr. Lynch) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To provide for a study on the use of social media in security clearance investigations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act of 2017.

section.header: Study on use of social media in security clearance investigations
section.text: Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall submit to Congress a report on the examination of social media activity during security clearance investigations, including—

paragraph.text: the current use of publicly available social media in security clearance background investigations;
any legal impediments to examining publicly available social media activity, and whether those impediments are statutory or regulatory in nature;
the results of any pilot programs to incorporate social media checks in such investigations, including the effectiveness and cost of such programs;
options for widespread implementation of the examination of social media activity during such investigations; and
estimates on the cost for such options as part of—

subparagraph.text: all Secret and Top Secret investigations.
